reviewText:
An absolute horror show, as well as an assault on the ears.
Dialogue is unbearable to listen to, story is non-sensical, visuals are all over the place, music is diabolical. I have no idea what is going on with this game, but it definitely does not belong on Steam.
However,
It's functional. And in this day and age on Steam, a game that actually works without breaking itself is a good start. There are quests you can partake in, combat is very much like a bullet-hell shooter if the bullets were able to not only collide into each other, but also remain on the map as movable objects, and you can level up, customise your b!tch bullets" as they were
date: and fight weird ghost things on the world map.\nA horrific
recommended: functional mess that has no place on Steam.\nHere's some gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=atmxewLfI8o"

reviewText:
Candice DeBébé's Incredibly Trick Lifestyle is essentially a joke/parody action RPG that follows an extremely chavvy women on a quest to retrieve the fake tan van that was stolen from her own town (Think Ali G). The graphics are bad, the story is bad, gameplay is also pretty bad but still I enjoyed my time playing this.

As a brit I can relate to the jokes and songs found in the game that are all very tongue in cheek. I feel a lot of this humour would be totally lost on other nationalities so if you aren’t British or in some way very knowledgeable of British culture this may be a total no no especially when it comes to the games soundtrack.

Along the way you gain items, fight bosses and go through a number of different worlds and levels in an ultra-light action RPG game. The game is bad… in most ways but (and you are probably going to just have to take my word on this) it is oddly fun to play and I found myself continuing even though my usual common sense indicator told me the game wasn’t any good.

At £3.99 or your regional equivalent there are better games out there but for the price of a pint in London, a magazine or a coffee you will find a gag game that will make you chuckle and offer at least something.

This game really isn’t for everyone and most will probably not “get it” but Candice DeBébé's Incredibly Trick Lifestyle is a massive tongue in cheek game that for those of you who will get the references is a giggle worth undertaking.

THIS GAME WAS OBTAINED VIA A KEY FROM THE DEVELOPER. MY OPINIONS ARE HOWEVER 100% MY OWN AND THE PRICE TO THE CONSUMER HAS BEEN TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT WHEN PRODUCING THIS REVIEW.

Please check our our video review where this text review was taken from:  Video Review[www.thegametutor.co.uk]

reviewText:
General review : so bad it's good / 10

Reasons you should NOT play this game :
- It uses Unity assets and textures, and the rest of the models look like play-doh dolls made by a chimpanze having a stroke
- All dialogues are written and voice acted in a strange dialect apparently branching off lolspeak
- The story, character design and sidequests make absolutely no sense
- The soundtrack is a series of drunkenly written songs about the main character's sex life
- The fighting mechanics are a horrifying mixture of all the previously listed elements, plus basic ♥♥♥♥♥ bullets
- The game in its entirety feels like a giant joke


Reasons you should TOTALLY play this game :
- It uses Unity assets and textures, and the rest of the models look like play-doh dolls made by a chimpanze having a stroke
- All dialogues are written and voice acted in a strange dialect apparently branching off lolspeak
- The story, character design and sidequests make absolutely no sense
- The soundtrack is a series of drunkenly written songs about the main character's sex life
- The fighting mechanics are a horrifying mixture of all the previously listed elements, plus basic ♥♥♥♥♥ bullets
- The game in its entirety feels like a giant joke

Candice Debébé's Incredibly Trick Lifestyle might look like the most half-♥♥♥♥♥ game of all times, which it objectively might really be. But if you take a step back and contemplate its inspiring personnality, you will realize that, despite its slight tendancy to make you wanna puke, this game is truly art in its purest form.

reviewText: Probably the most original video game soundtrack and script that I've ever experienced.  In a world full of sequels and rip-offs, Candice DeBébé's Incredibly Trick Lifestyle offers something unique and special.  Expect ~5 hours of gameplay and lots of smiling.\n\nAnd really, watch the trailer before buying.  I think it should be immediately clear if this game is for you or not.

reviewText: I don't understand why anyone is taking this game seriously. Look, it's a gag game. If you purchased this thinking this is some deep philosophical game with interesting mechanics then you're an idiot. The video on this steam page and the screenshots is basically what you're getting. Anyway, I laughed pretty hard how ridiculous this game is. If you're into stupid humor and looking for a gag gift for your friends this is the ultimate video game. 10/10 all around.

reviewText: Lesser developers would have came up with this insane idea, built a quick prototype with 10 minutes of gameplay, then got bored and moved onto other things. But not this dev. Whoever developed this game has true staying power. They actually followed through and fleshed out everything. Part of what makes this game a sublime masterpiece, is that it just shouldn't exist. And yet it does... It is horribly awful in just about every regard;  yet the bad is juxstaposed with the obvious effort that's went into it. I have to respect that tenacity.

reviewText: This is a game about hardships and trials. Friendship and felony. Sour cream and onions. The game consists of a story line that is more complicated than the instructions of an electric toothbrush and character depth more deep than the titanic wreak. The quests are on par with World of Warcraft. My emotions for these people resonate the same feeling of using a belt sander to shave. The graphics beat any modern gen game by making use of the resourceful SculptGL engine and is very eco friendly. I cannot reccomend this game enough.

reviewText:
TRIGGER WARNING: By playing this game you will be exposed to a man with a Derby accent and all the psychological horrors this may entail. There are scenes where the aforementioned Derby man plays four different female characters and in effect is having a conversation with himself in varying degrees of falsetto. There is a serious risk that you may lose your sanity as a result of exposure to this. I was able to survive by punching myself in the testes until I passed out but it was a close call.

The explosive final entry in the acclaimed Candice DeBébé trilogy didn't disappoint, except on one count. As a diehard fan of the series, I am enraged that the continuity of the series has been rebooted. After Candice triumphantly battled to obtain a council house she has now inexplicably found herself in a trailer park, which I can only attribute to attempting to break the American market. At what cost, havishamone games? For shame. Spit in the faces of your most loyal fans and casually widdle all over the legacy of Candice DeBébé why don't you? This is just like the Mass Effect 3 ending all over again.

A word on the soundtrack - an OST, no less! Every area has been thematically designed with a real intricacy and as such you will really appreciate how much you hate every new song you encounter. It doesn't matter though, when it hits its third or fourth loop it's already too late. You will be merrily singing along to every song and won't notice that your surroundings have somehow morphed into the ninth circle of Hell.

I can't decide whether it's gaming's Citizen Kane or gaming's The Room.

reviewText:
E: Since someone lame accused me of a paid review here's[i.imgur.com] my transaction history as long as that's any proof

(I played the demo before writing this review, so my playtime is slightly longer)

A brilliant commentary on the hardships of life, Greenlight games and magical bitches.

Pros:
- beautiful graphics, AAA games ain't got nothing on this gem
- incredible story (brought me to tears)
- memorable characters with a surprising amount of depth
- immersive gameplay without dumb gimmicks
- soundtrack deserves a Grammy

Cons:
- controls can get pretty bad without a gamepad
(- no candice background!!!!)

I really recommend checking this game out. In my opinion, this is GotY 2016.
If, for whatever reason, you're not sure if it's worth the price tag, you can try out the demo[www.mediafire.com] and listen to the sountrack[soundcloud.com].
